channel.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
channel.description:
Trailer came out today: http://youtube.com/watch?v=QB9ApSJ9nJo
I don't think it will be as good as Modern Warfare, though I look forward to it!
Your thoughts?

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Doubt they’ll add vechiles in it, CoD is more about the actual shooting, so i’ll guess they’d rather concentrate on that.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty 5: World At War

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:13, topic:214400”]E3 is soon, maybe we’ll find out then.

[quote]Activision lifts the lid on Call of Duty: World at War, co-op play confirmed

Leave your packs and bring extra ammo, Activision, Inc. and Treyarch, announced today that they will be taking Call of Duty players deep into the South Pacific and European theaters this fall for Call of Duty: World at War™, a gritty fight that will pit players against enemies that know no surrender and show no mercy.[/quote]

Co-op mode![/quote]
Porbly going to bring tanks and Humvees, 30 person multiplayer map like a real battle field

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty 5: World At War

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

Thug-life:

CoD3 > CoD4 imo, so i’ll probably enjoy this one for longer than i did cod4.

i think cod3 was the worst of all of them so far. i dont see what made it any different or better than cod2.

anywho, i think cod4 would have been a great way to end the series, but maybe i will be pleasantly surprised.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty 5: World At War

Leave your packs and bring extra ammo, Activision, Inc. and Treyarch, announced today that they will be taking Call of Duty players deep into the South Pacific and European theaters this fall for Call of Duty: World at War™, a gritty fight that will pit players against enemies that know no surrender and show no mercy.[/quote]

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

E3 is soon, maybe we’ll find out then.

Activision lifts the lid on Call of Duty: World at War, co-op play confirmed

Leave your packs and bring extra ammo, Activision, Inc. and Treyarch, announced today that they will be taking Call of Duty players deep into the South Pacific and European theaters this fall for Call of Duty: World at War™, a gritty fight that will pit players against enemies that know no surrender and show no mercy.

Co-op mode!

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty 5: World At War

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:10, topic:214400”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=282069.msg2291077#msg2291077 date=1214164208]

Maybe when the developers switch on 6 they will go back to modern, though I’m thinking it might be future.

Only time will tell.

i can almost garuntee you it won’t be future, if you look at the call of duty games they strive for realism, accuracy and attention to detail with future it hasnt happened so it is uncertain
[/quote]

STFU. It could easily be the future, rumours are goinhg around that it will be and now two Infinity Ward reps have leaked hints on it.

You can’t guarantee shit.

I personally hope it will be near future, like 10 years from now (like ghost recon is) and will include snow. Snow owns.[/quote]
notice why i said ‘almost’

[quote=“Thug-life, post:11, topic:214400”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=282069.msg2291077#msg2291077 date=1214164208]
i can almost garuntee you it won’t be future, if you look at the call of duty games they strive for realism, accuracy and attention to detail with future it hasnt happened so it is uncertain
[/quote]
Infinity ward have already said that they are working on a futuristic game, but if that game is CoD6 is something we won’t know for some time.[/quote]
There is a chance it may indeed be CoD6 but i would hope not, i prefer it when it is realistic and accurate

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:

[quote=“sanga282, post:9, topic:214400”][quote author=casey. link=topic=282069.msg2290758#msg2290758 date=1214134765]
Maybe when the developers switch on 6 they will go back to modern, though I’m thinking it might be future.

Only time will tell.
[/quote]
i can almost garuntee you it won’t be future, if you look at the call of duty games they strive for realism, accuracy and attention to detail with future it hasnt happened so it is uncertain[/quote]

STFU. It could easily be the future, rumours are goinhg around that it will be and now two Infinity Ward reps have leaked hints on it.

You can’t guarantee shit.

I personally hope it will be near future, like 10 years from now (like ghost recon is) and will include snow. Snow owns.

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

This isn’t made by Infinity Ward… so it’s not going to be as good as COD4. I’m probably going to get it though as I’ve always loved the old WW2 games, what with the old fashioned rifles and the famous Thompson.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty 5: World At War
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I think it would be better if they altered, leave Treyarch to the past and IW to the present/future.

Environments are now more destructible and can be set on fire with the flamethrower (which features propagating fire). Bullets can also cut holes in thin wood, making a gap big enough for the player to climb through.

Heh, sounds like Bad Company on crack.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty 5: World At War

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Holy fk burning bodies look awesome.

I cant wait, a good graphiced world war 2 game is what we need, but modern warfare had a good spice that they will never match up with ww2. We will wait and see.
